prompt: To survey student opinions, you only ask students in the library at 2am. What problem affects your sample?
hint: Who studies in the library at 2am? Are they representative of all students?
explanation: This is selection bias - your sample isn't representative. Students at the library at 2am are probably more studious, more stressed about exams, or have different schedules than average students. A good sample should represent the whole population you're studying.
visual_concept: Sampling: Trying to learn about fish in a pond but only fishing at the surface. You'll miss all the bottom-dwellers!
